text: In recent years, ransomware tools have been commoditized,
just about anyone can access these tools on the dark web
and use them effectively with very little training or skill.
Businesses need to develop a regular cadence for patching and hardening their systems.
Using AWS can help bolster your security posture
and make your business more resilient to ransomware attacks.
Using AWS managed services places the responsibility for patching software and operating systems squarely on AWS.
SMB IT teams don't have to worry about maintaining and patching these services.
There are also a number of security tools provided by AWS that can help with bolstering your security posture.
You can use Amazon Inspector to identify vulnerabilities and assess instances against security benchmarks.
If you're deploying containerized software, you can use Amazon Elastic Container Registry to scan and identify vulnerabilities in your container images.
AWS Systems Manager Patch Manager enables you to deploy OS and software patches automatically on a predefined schedule.
Our customers want to know that their data is secure and protected.
By leveraging the power of AWS, our customers can build secure and robust systems that place an emphasis on data protection.
